page.title: 05RED HALL, BOURNE
page.content: A place of{local historical}interest is{The Red Hall.}It was built in the 16th.century by Gilbert Fisher. In the dining room it has oak panels. Round the bottom half of the room the seats are velvet. In the 18th century {The {Red Hall}passed to the Digby family of North Luffenham. The Hall remained with the family until it was sold to Bourne and Essendine Railway Company. Twelve years later the railway company decided to destroy the hall. Fortunately, there were enough people to organize a campaign to keep it open. Today, {The Red Hall}is used for parties and special occasions. It is open to the public every morning except on Sundays.
